title: No log output when running in Python shell
body:
While filing #2986 saw that we have no log output while working in Python:
```shell
$> python
Python 2.7.14 (default, Sep 17 2017, 18:50:44) 
[GCC 7.2.0] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from datalad.api import run; run("touch 1234; exit 1");
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad/venvs/dev/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 479, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad/venvs/dev/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 467, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad/venvs/dev/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 455, in generator_func
    msg="Command did not complete successfully")
datalad.support.exceptions.IncompleteResultsError: Command did not complete successfully [{'action': u'run', 'path': u'/tmp/testds', 'message': u'unsaved modifications present, cannot detect changes by command', 'status': u'impossible', 'type': u'dataset'}]
>>> 
```
even if I set `DATALAD_LOG_LEVEL`:
```shell
$> DATALAD_LOG_LEVEL=INFO python
Python 2.7.14 (default, Sep 17 2017, 18:50:44) 
[GCC 7.2.0] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from datalad.api import run; run("touch 1234; exit 1");
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad/venvs/dev/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 479, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad/venvs/dev/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 467, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad/venvs/dev/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 455, in generator_func
    msg="Command did not complete successfully")
```
